content: One thing I don’t see here is the data around which of the men and women had closes correlated against these 3 metrics. It could be that the women with higher close rates are not the same as those who are interrupting or talking more etc. It could be a larger majority of women, over an average, show these traits but the outlier women who are below average and perhaps below the men are making the vast majority of the sales. (A bit of the 80/20 rule could be in play, so to speak)
